actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend section 321 (a) of the Tariff Act of 1930, as amended (19 U.S.C.  1321(a)), to simplify customs procedures.

summary.text: Amends the Tariff Act of 1930 to authorize the Secretary of the Treasury to disregard a difference between estimated customs duties deposited and tentatively assessed and total duties accruing thereon. Authorizes the Secretary to admit duty-free (1) gifts valued at $25, (2) gifts from the Virgin Islands, Guam, or American Samoa, valued at $40 (3) personal or household articles valued at $25 accompanying persons entering the United States who are not entitled to specified exemptions, or (4) articles valued at five dollars in any other case.

titles.title: A bill to amend section 321 (a) of the Tariff Act of 1930, as amended (19 U.S.C.  1321(a)), to simplify customs procedures.
